name: The Angel Hotel

reviews.text: Lunched at The Angel on Wednesday 10 October 2012 and it exceeded all our expectations. Our car being parked for us by the porter was a great start. We had pre-lunch drinks in the stunning lounge area, which had several different extremely comfortable and beautifully furnished areas to choose from. We had a lovely table in the restaurant and our 3-course set menu meal was fabulous - can't fault a thing. The service was friendly and professional and the whole experience has made me want to go back there and stay rather than just having a long, luxurious, leisurely lunch! 10 out of 10!
reviews.title: Lunch at The Angel

reviews.text: Great time here from check in to check out. Great position opposite the cathedral and grounds and perfect for wandering around the pretty streets of Bury St Edmunds.
reviews.title: Perfect Position and Lovely Staff

reviews.text: Room was fine - little bit tired and could do with a lick of paint and a new carpet but nothing that bothered me. Great service in the restaurant by Darek (sp?). Delicious roasted chicory - a first for me. Bistro type food and bistro type surrondings. Slept very well, had a wander around the abbey gardens before breakfast and then had the best cooked breakfast I've had outside of home. Freshly cooked to order, good quality and no grease in sight. Proper pot of tea with tea leaves too!
reviews.title: Really friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: We were in Bury for a wedding and were recommended to The Angel Hotel. Very impressed! It is an old style town centre hotel which has been refurbished to a good standard. Room was a good size and immaculately clean fresh and bathroom had great powerful shower.
reviews.title: Very pleasant Saturday lunch

reviews.text: The best part of the hotel thought was the helpfulness of the staff. They were so friendly and willing to help in any way.
reviews.title: Ideal for a Family weekend

reviews.text: Cracking location in the centre of Bury makes this a perfect place to stay if you are wishing to explore the town. Despite being in the centre, the rooms dont suffer from traffice noise or revellers.
reviews.title: To be recommended

reviews.text: The plumbing does however make some strange noises in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Very disappointed with bedroom
Fabulous hotel, great service
reviews.text: The room was comfortable but had a few annoying faults, crack in hand basin for example but generally neat and tidy.
What made the stay special was the excellent food, some of the best I've tasted, certainly outside Lonpon.
reviews.title: Very nice break

reviews.text: Also the willing and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for just a Saturday night for a birthday celebration. All in all a good choice, Stylish public areas, Clean comfy rooms, Lovely cooked to order breakfast. Just a couple of minor niggles (ill fitting windows + bath panel coming off) Excellent location, all Bury has to offer within a few minutes walk.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, very well situated

reviews.text: I visited this hotel twice on business in October. Both stays were perfect. The staff are lovely and can't do enough for you. The rooms are immaculate and really different. On my second stay, I was lucky enough to get room 20 which is absolutely stunning. The fixtures are amazing and it was the nicest room I have ever stayed in. The bathroom was amazing and I wanted to pick it up and take it home! There are patio doors onto a little terrace with a small table and 2 chairs. Although it was October, it was quite mild so it was nice to enjoy the late afternoon sun relaxing out there.
reviews.title: Out of this world!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is really exceptional, all my evening meals were superb. I had the best steak and chips I have ever eaten. Handmade chips...divine! Also, a really varied menu which changes regularly and has different specials each day. The staff were lovely and really attentive. The Suffolk grill breakfast is not to be missed!
reviews.title: Excellent stay, great location

reviews.text: Overall,a really lovely place to stay for business or pleasure in a perfect location,
reviews.title: fabulous
Ok lunch
reviews.text: The Angel is located in the heart of Bury St Edmunds but with free parking.

We recently visited the Angel for lunch while shopping in Bury. The dining room was very modern and tastefully decorated. The menu had a lot of choice (especially fresh fish) and seemed very seasonal. The service was attentive and food arrived promptly. The food was not outstanding, more "bistro" like but tasty none the less. The only thing that let the meal down was the waitress getting the bill wrong (which unfortuantely has happened before!)
reviews.title: Light Lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We popped into the Angel for a drink before dinner elsewhere as we have done so many times before. Strange that they had no Bacardi or white rum in an establishment of this so called repute. Drinks are not cheap but you know that and have a choice not to!!!!! We decided to visit again after dinner at 10.30 pm. We went to the bar and were asked to wait whilst the bar stewardess had something to finish. Then we saw here and 2 other colleagues walk in with a birthday cake for guest sthat had dined, which again we had no problem with which they sang Happy Birthday to and then cut the cake.Eventually the lady returned ( this was now 15 minutes after she 1st spoke to us) and asked if we were guests or had dined there. We advised no. She advised as neither she could not serve us as it was to busy!!!! I asked why did she not ask this in the 1st instance and it was no longer busy as many tables and chairs were now empty. She would not change her position I spoke with the bar manager on the way out to advise of our displeasure and their poor service.I suggest in the future folks go to the One Bull nearby for pre and post dinners drinks as they have a very wide range of real ale, beers and wine.
reviews.title: I only wanted a drink!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night for our wedding anniversary, and upgraded to the Romantic suite when we booked in. Room was fantastic - very clean, well decorated and on the top floor, so very quiet. The room faced the cathedral and Market Square opposite, so you could recline in the comfy chairs and watch the World go by. The bathroom had a big copper slipper bath and a really good and powerful seperate shower - included really good toiletries.
reviews.title: Fantastic but pricey

reviews.text: We had booked the Sunday Night Deal, in which dinner came included in the price up to a maximum of £60 (you paid anything above that). We had drinks in the Lounge while browsing the menu in front of a roaring fire. The food was excellent, and the service good.
reviews.title: Good enough for Charles Dickens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Car parking was not a problem as you just abandoned the car at the front of the hotel, then one of the porters parked the car and brought your luggage up to the room. Reception hold onto your car keys in case they need to move the car. The staff were very attentive whenever we needed anything.
reviews.title: Lovely but overpriced

description: This Georgian ivy clad 4 star boutique hotel and restaurant in Suffolk surprises with a twist of urban chic.Our Suffolk hotel is right in the centre of Bury St Edmunds town centre and everything is just a step from here. Explore winding, cobbled, shop filled streets and a plethora of ancient architecture on the doorstep.Once inside, the Angel Hotel is a curious contrast of comfy contemporary design with touches of exotic grandeur. Warm leather sofas vie for your company in the lounge, which is filled with curiosities, pop art, eccentric oddities and cool vintage furniture. It is a hotel of many different aspects all artfully blended together into an exciting package and the bedrooms are no exception. The restaurant has a great reputation and dining here is a culinary treat.In 2012, the hotel opened our new Wingspan bar. Decadently curious and located in the 12th Century vault under the hotel, Wingspan is the perfect location to meet with friends, for pre-dinner drinks, or simply to relax after a long day.
